key_findings: DIPLOMATIC frame dominates across all sources except Israeli media (50% US mainstream, 50% Al Jazeera, 52.9% UK)
Israeli media shows distinctly different framing: 45.5% PROXY focus and 36.4% THREAT vs only 18.2% DIPLOMATIC
NO headlines in any source coded as CONFLICT - suggests framing focuses on threats rather than active military action
DOMESTIC coverage minimal: only in US mainstream (21.4%), Al Jazeera (7.1%), and UK (17.6%); ZERO in Israeli media
Israeli sources exhibit strongest threat framing (36.4% THREAT + 45.5% PROXY = 81.9% threat-related)
UK media most diplomatic-heavy (52.9%) with balanced mix of THREAT and DOMESTIC
Ambiguous cases: 4 headlines blended DIPLOMATIC/THREAT elements (items 2, 27, 50, 53, 51, 39, 46, 54) - coded based on dominant element
Dataset contained 60 headlines; 2 unrelated items excluded (#20 Maduro, #58 Iraqi militants - not Iran-related), 58 coded
PROXY framing primarily concentrated in Israeli sources (5/6 total PROXY frames across dataset)
